title: print the recipe spack uses to install a thing
body:
print the recipe so a user can replicate what Spack does, outside of Spack

### Rationale

This would greatly help in replicating build problems when trying to debug a package, or permitting workarounds for build problems, or helping our users with "here is a recipe to build that software in your home directory"

### Description

I'd love to see output something like:
```
mycluster$ spack install --print-recipe libxml2
## Spack: satisfying dependency libiconv with
# spack install libiconv@1.16%gcc@8.3.0~static arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
## Spack: satisfying dependency zlib with:
# spack install zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.3.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
## Spack: stage directory is:
# cd /path/to/stage/dir
## Spack: fetching libxml2 with:
# wget http://xmlsoft.org/sources/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
## Spack: verifying download with
## (whatever commands compare sha256)
## Spack: unpacking:
# tar xzf libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
## Spack: configuring
# cd libxml2-2.9.9
# ./configure --blah --blah --options-spack-uses 
## Spack: building
# make -j 4
## Spack: installing
# make install
```

### Additional information

This is somewhat related to #10947 (support for --dry-run)
